text: Bit surprised Cradle hasn't made this list yet, but this was a good choice nonetheless. One thing I liked about this game's OST is how the industrial sound effects used in the tracks reflected those used in the movie. Definitely a grittier, colder Bond score.

author: meamlawless

author: LMWYBC1996

text: Speaking of influential games, Goldeneye is definitely one of those. I spent a ridiculous amount of time playing through the single player campaign over and over﻿ again and ended up knowing all the levels perfectly. I spent even more time playing split screen multiplayer and it's some of the best time I've ever had playing with friends while sharing a couch. We'd especially love playing Proximity Mines only matches.
author: SupraDarky

text: Back from the small vacation and so starts the countdown of my 30 favorite games of all time! I think you'll be surprised by the absence of some very high profile/influential games. It was hard to seperate what I think are the best games ever, and which ones are my personal favorites (there is a difference, mainly involving nostalgia). And remember... I was a Nintendo kid growing up. ;)
author: SupraDarky
